awd_titl_txt: Improvement of a Forensic Chemistry Course by Means of an   Atomic Absorption Spectrometer
awd_abstract_narration: In response to perceived societal need and with the                        encouragement of local criminalist, the Whitworth College                       Chemistry Department has inaugurated an upper-level course in                   forensic chemistry.  The purchase of an Atomic Absorption (AA)                  Spectrometer with a graphite furnace has enhanced the laboratory                component of this course.  This instrument is used in the                       analysis of paint scrapings and small samples of glass.  The AA                 is also used in instrumental analysis, physical chemistry and                   research.  This instrument provides our students with state of                  the art instrumentation and "real world" examples.  The                         institution is matching the NSF grant with an equal amount of                   funds.
